widget.name: WinJS.UI.AppBar
widget.description: Represents an application toolbar for display commands.

property.name: element
property.description: The DOM element the AppBar is attached to

property.name: disabled
property.description: Disable an AppBar. When disabled the AppBar will animate off of the screen, stop firing events and will no longer respond to method or property changes until it is re-enabled. If another part of the App takes control of the commandBar while the AppBar is disabled, the AppBar will not know about it and will not respond to commandBar events. Re-enabling an AppBar will take back control of the commandBar and overwrite the commandBar's current state with the commands and state of the re-enabled AppBar.

property.name: hidden
property.description: Read only, true if the AppBar is currently not open.

property.name: placement
property.description: The placement of the AppBar on the display. The only value for phone is"bottom".

property.name: layout
property.description: The layout of the AppBar contents. "Commands is the only value on phone"

property.name: sticky
property.description: The value that indicates whether the AppBar is sticky. false is the only value on phone.

property.name: commands
property.description: Gets/Sets the AppBarCommands in the AppBar. This property accepts an array of AppBarCommand objects.

property.name: closedDisplayMode
property.description: Gets/Sets how AppBar will display itself while closed. Values are "compact" and "minimal".

part.name: appBarCustom
part.description: Style for a custom layout AppBar.
